thread.title: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 22
thread.title_full: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 22

author: Dan England
title: Our fave things to do beginning Oct. 22
text: Expand Photo The Golden Dragon Acrobats perform at 6:30 p.m. tonight at the Union Colony Civic Center, 701 10th Ave. in downtown Greeley. The acrobats are the premiere Chinese acrobatic touring company in the world. Go to ucstars.com or (970) 356-5000 for tickets. Expand Photo Tribe Sidysaan's annual Belly Hallow event takes place at 6 p.m. Saturday at the Atlas Theater, 709 16th St. in Greeley. Tickets are $7, but if you wear a Tribe shirt or Halloween costume, it's only $5. Belly Hallow features live music, special guests and, of course, belly dancing performances. Expand Photo Greeley El Teatro, a multilingual theater company that features immigrant and refugee students telling their stories, will perform at 7 p.m. Friday at Christ Community Church, 1301 15th St., Greeley. Tickets are $10 for adults, $5 for students and children, and free for those 5 and under. Dessert is included. Tickets are available at the door or by contacting Jessica Cooney at (970) 348-5490 or jcooney1@greeleyschools.org. Expand Photo The UNC Opera Theater Society singers will perform 7:30-9:30 p.m. tonight for free at the Currier Inn, 1221 9th Ave. in Greeley. All donations for refreshments go to the UNC student program. The performance is a part of the Currier Inn House Concert Series.
